text.text_translated: Between 100,000 and 50,000 years ago, though, we started to see evidence of early human civilisation, for example, through cave paintings; no one knows the connection between this and language. Brains didn't suddenly get bigger, yet humans did become more complex and more intelligent. Was it the use of language that caused their brains to develop? Or did their more complex brains start to produce language?
